update.description:
Re-enbled saving of ogre terrain tile data to disk in the `~/.gazebo/paging` directory. The benefit is more evident with large heightmaps. The first time a large heightmap is loaded, it'll take longer for gazebo to launch due to the additional step of writing data to disk. Subsequent launches should be faster as ogre would no longer need to generate the tiles again.

[Here](https://www.dropbox.com/s/0b6uqlr6s3yjvv7/red_dem.zip?dl=0) is a large dem heightmap to test with. From local testing: 

First run:
~~~
[Msg] Heightmap loaded. Process took: 5.39788 seconds
[Msg] Saving heightmap cache data to /home/ian/.gazebo/paging/dem
[Msg] Heightmap cache data saved. Process took: 7.12726 seconds.
~~~

Second run:
~~~
[Msg] Heightmap loaded. Process took: 1.62002 seconds
~~~

jenkins:

[xenial-nvidia](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64-gpu-nvidia/69/) - ok

[abi](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/243/API_ABI_report/) - ok

content.raw:
Cool, this works for me, the loading time went from 4.22404 to 1.39109. I also tried changing the `.tif` file and checked that the cached data is re-saved.

One suggestion would be to print that the data is being loaded from disk on the second run, and where it's being loaded from.
content.html:
Cool, this works for me, the loading time went from 4.22404 to 1.39109. I also tried changing the .tif file and checked that the cached data is re-saved.

One suggestion would be to print that the data is being loaded from disk on the second run, and where it's being loaded from.

update.title: Cache heightmap tile data

content.raw: Note that I tested heightmap caching with `use_terrain_paging` set to `true` in ogre 1.8 and 1.9 but found that gazebo crashes on startup. Same thing happens on `gazebo7` branch without changes in this PR. The original [heightmap paging PR](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/687/terrain-paging-support-for-rendering/diff) mentions that it probably only works with ogre 1.7.4
content.html: Note that I tested heightmap caching with use_terrain_paging set to true in ogre 1.8 and 1.9 but found that gazebo crashes on startup. Same thing happens on gazebo7 branch without changes in this PR. The original heightmap paging PR mentions that it probably only works with ogre 1.7.4
